instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Diagnose No Fan / Power without frame?
threads.message: Got a customer who sent me only the motherboard and said it will not boot, no fans.  Is it possible to "Prompt to boot" this board?  I have an 80W adapter and battery here, but no shell to put it in.  Just need to make sure I fix the fans not kicking on apparently.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Diagnose No Fan / Power without frame?
threads.message: Yes it should autopower on being it's an Intel Core. For sure known good 85 watt OEM Magsafe 1 adapter? Any history liquid drop etc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Diagnose No Fan / Power without frame?
threads.message: Not sure honestly.  Was just sent in and customer said it would not turn on.... just died.  Board looks clean, no water damage or broken off components.  I get a green light when connected to the OEM AC adapter and no battery and the same solid green light when connected to a battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Diagnose No Fan / Power without frame?
threads.message: Do you have a fan to plug in by chance? If not, measure if CPU VCore is present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Diagnose No Fan / Power without frame?
threads.message:
If you detect a little drop on VCORE, few seconds after starts, board should work.
I normally test the boards with USB mouse and OSX pendrive (with Link LED).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Diagnose No Fan / Power without frame?
threads.message: I connected the MB to the battery I had in stock from a used system and let it sit plugged in over the weekend.... came in this morning and the fans were spinning at 100%.  Still have too hook up a screen and keyboard, but there is life....  Charging light stays green no matter what though.  May try an SMC reset to see if it changes anything.
